extendedInfo.description: Comica is THE digital comic reader and image viewer for Android devices. It has a beautiful graphical interface, that uses the thumbnails of your comics organised in simple and pleasing ways. Full dual-pane mode is available and you can even take snapshots of images you have zoomed into and store those separately. Bookmarks per comic are of course supported.Comica can scan for comics on your sdcard, add those to your collection, and organise them all based on the folder structure you have placed them in. Very easy. You may also search your SDCard using the file browser option and find the relevant comic or image files that way. Best, width, height and '1 to 1' aspect ratios are supported. Dual Pane MODE now supported!Controls :- 	1) Tap once on the screen to bring up the image controls.	2) Double tap to zoom in and out.        3) Pinch and Zoom.	4) Touch and move.       	5) Tap side of screen to turn page.		6) Flick finger left or right to change page - or use the image controls.Press Menu > Options on the main screen for the system settings.You can even add an extra folder to be scanned - or scan the whole system..  Accepted file formats : -	1) .cbr, .cbz for comics        2) ,jpg, .jpeg, .png, .gif, .bmp for imagesAll temporary files and thumbnails are stored in the folder 'Comica'.TROUBLE : Every effort is made to ensure a bug-free application. If you do encounter a problem - SEND ME AN EMAIL! and I'll fix it. Write a harsh comment with no real info and I'll stumble around in the dark trying to find the bug - psychically. Your choice. LITE VERSION : The lite version is banner supported (inoffensive banner at bottom of screen). Upgrade to the full version of Comica to remove the banner. Otherwise the applications are the same!

reviews.title: Great Stuff
reviews.comment: Easy to use UI, and clean layout. Scans automatically to find the comics in SD, very well done! Will definitely pay for full! Good stuff keep updates coming!
reviews.author: Kirk Misquita

reviews.title: Best comic reader
reviews.comment: The best comic reader I have tried so far on my tablet. Page turn is a bit laggy and sometimes opens the wrong comic on startup but is still wayyy less buggy than anything else.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Well organized and user-friendly
reviews.comment: Impressive listing UI and responsive developer. Doesn\'t have a hook, such as pop-out text, but a great choice overall.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: A pain to locate comics stored on an external SD
reviews.comment: I store my comics on an external (removable) micro SD card. If you do too, Comica has no browser to locate the folder. You must type the path out in a text box. Strike one.  When I did type in the path (/mnt/external_sd/comics), it told me there was no such folder. Strike two. Perfect Viewer had no such problems and let me browse to the folder. And no ads. Sorry Comica. That\'s just one, two, three strikes you\'re out.    UPDATE: I did manage to get the program to recognize my folder. And once it works, the UI is beautiful. However, I still say there needs to be a simpler way to add an extra folder. Having to type out the path sucks. Also, in my Comics folder I have series in sub-folders and one shots just in the main folder. Comica had issues with that and hid all my one shots, though in Perfect Viewer and Komik that wasn\'t an issue.    And some files it just would not open, though PV had no problem opening them.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: only one good thing
reviews.comment: This viewer has only one good thing over others like acv, the list layout. Besides this, it is slow and not in anyway better.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Well done!
reviews.comment: This reader does what it\'s supposed to and has great visuals for an easy interface.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Ugh
reviews.comment: UI for page flipping is dreadful... Constantly prompting if I want to go to next comic instead of loading next page.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Disappointing
reviews.comment: Viewing comics is painful. Scrolling isn\'t intuitive.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Sony Xperia PLAY
reviews.comment: This is a fantastic comic reader.  I\'ve tried several but this is far superior in both functionality and interface design. Using the free version which features minimal advertising and does not interrupt viewing.  Best in it\'s category by far.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: The best on the market!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: UI is good bit functions less than \'perfect viewer\' app.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Not work at all.
reviews.comment: This application somehow didn\'t work in my galaxy note. It simply stopped when I want to use it. I have tried to reinstalled several times, but it didn\'t work. Because of that I gave only 1 star.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Love it!
reviews.comment: Great look, easy functionality, just needs the option to stop the screen free scrolling when fitted to width or height.....
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Poor app.
reviews.comment: Poor app ....... Don\'t wast your time on this app it sucks ..............
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: FC
reviews.comment: Force close on Acer A500 and HTC One S.

reviews.title: Scrolling issues
reviews.comment: Beautiful UI but the scrolling is sluggish  Please work on the it :-)

reviews.comment: Spoke too soon.
